text:
<@U6K08UK96> I don't think I understand the question.
Workspace has to run first (that's what the snapshot link is doing)
Then a preview of Drupal website will appear inside the 'vscode' interface.
From there - people can open that link using the diagonal arrow on top-right, if they want to open it in a new tab

text:
Agree that any remaining tasks should be explicitly declared.

Some of them were addressed and comments were made in the MR (like the color issue) to that effect. But in my case, having jumped just recently on this, I’m not sure about which comments/suggestions bare which weight. If they go into the IS then it’s clear they need to be addressed.

I addressed the feedback that was in the MR and actually fixed the tests. The last run came green as far as I can see.

attachments.fallback: Drupal.org: Project messaging channel in core (as experimental)
attachments.text: Problem/Motivation Per the core idea issue: [#2940739] The vast majority of Drupal users do not have accounts on <http://Drupal.org|Drupal.org>, and likely do not regularly follow Drupal project news, or engage with communications channels that promote important updates, news and events, or support for the community and association. The goal of this initiative is to provide a channel for messaging about the Drupal project within the administrative interface of core.
attachments.title: Project messaging channel in core (as experimental)
